str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Injustice, unrighteousness, hurt. From adikos; injustice; morally, wrongfulness.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To place together, commend, prove, exhibit; instrans: I stand with; To be composed of, cohere.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To bring forward (against), impose, inflict. From epi and phero; to bear upon, i.e. Adduce (accuse, inflict), superinduce.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From oregomai; properly, desire, i.e., violent passion (justifiable) abhorrence); by implication punishment.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
